questions.question: I met him in Germany three years .........................
questions.description: We use ago with a past tense and a time expression to count back from the present.

questions.question: Have you been here ...........................?
questions.description: Before can be used with a present perfect tense or past perfect tense to mean 'at any time before now/then'.

questions.question: I was in Spain two years ........................
questions.description: We use ago with a past tense and a time expression to count back from the present.

questions.question: The two girls are ........................ in looks, but not in personality.
questions.description: Alike can mean like each other.

questions.question: I have been round ........................ looking for the dog.
questions.description: We can use all with some singular countable nouns to mean every part of.

questions.question: You have eaten ……………….. loaf.
questions.description: We cannot use all before definite articles.

questions.question: We are very ..................... finished.
questions.description: Almost cannot be used with very.

questions.question: ……………. I don’t agree with him, I think he is sincere.
questions.description: We use even if to talk about hypothetical situations.

questions.question: I have got …………….. energy than I used to have.
questions.description: Less is the comparative form of little.

questions.question: Thank you very much. That was ………………. of you.
questions.description: When most means very, the article the is not used with it.

questions.question: They experienced little difficulty …………….. the money.
questions.description: After difficulty we use ‘in + ing form’.

questions.question: We are having ……………… weather.
questions.description: Weather is uncountable. It cannot be used with articles.
